summary: Pre-Orders Extended Two Weeks! Hello hello from the stars, we have some exciting news! Due to several requests and some upcoming...
caption:
Pre-Orders Extended Two Weeks!

Hello hello from the stars, we have some exciting news! Due to several requests and some upcoming sales with our printers, your star-catchers have decided to extend Into the Stars pre-orders until March 17, 11:59 PM (PST). 

We hope you enjoy a sneak peek into our incredible zine as well! We’re a little over halfway to our first goal, so now’s your chance to help us do a final push so that everyone can receive the adorable star Deku patch designed by @schaafdraws 🌟

Pre-orders won’t be extended again, don’t miss out!

Preview artists in order of appearance: @bekonuizado @glitzbot @ezaria-umiko-art @canarielle @crimson-chains @erazr @cirahpes

blog.name: raeynbowboi
blog.title: It Has To Be You
blog.description: A place to air out my love for Kiribaku/Bakushima

summary: Me: ships Kiribaku, Miritama, Inatodo, Tododeku, Kamisero, Dave Might, Hawksdeavor, and to a lesser extent Erasermic, Shinkami,...
body:
Me: ships Kiribaku, Miritama, Inatodo, Tododeku, Kamisero, Dave Might, Hawksdeavor, and to a lesser extent Erasermic, Shinkami, and Bakuyami.

Me: Gee, I wonder why I don’t sense any romantic chemistry between the male and female characters and almost exclusively only care about the gay pairings.

My Hero Academia: puts little to no focus on the only five female characters who have only been minor parts of the plot and gotten only morsels of character development to the point where most of them are pretty flat and under developed.

Me: Guess it’s a mystery.

summary: You come here often?” “Well, I work here. So I think I’d have to say ‘yes’.” with Hawks please?
question: You come here often?” “Well, I work here. So I think I’d have to say ‘yes’.” with Hawks please?
answer:
~Admin Blue

“You come here often?” A low ‘whoosh’ cut through the dull hum of the shop, followed by the clatter of various disposable cups hitting the ground behind the counter. His smirk dropped as he jumped to catch the bulk of them, and dropped the armful of cups on the counter. His wings twitched and pulled in against his back once more, careful not to aggravate the mess any further.

“Well, I work here. So I think I’d have to say ‘yes’.” You sighed. Great. Now you had to re-stack those. There wasn’t a single week where that didn’t happen, Hawks visit or not. “What’s your order?”

“Same as always.” He grinned as he leaned on the counter. As far as he was concerned, you were the only person who ever got his coffee juuust right, and after patrolling all night he needed it. “Large.”

Come to think of it, you’d seen Hawks in all forms, be it well-rested and on his way to some conference, or caked with dirt with sad clumps of feathers where his wings once proudly sprouted. Not that he got easier to deal with. It was always something with him.

“Long shift?” He asked, that dumb smirk still on his face as he watched you move about. His hands were busy smoothing a few crooked feathers on the edge of a wing. “Any trouble?”

“No, thankfully.” While Hawks could be annoyingly distracting at times, at least his frequent presence kept the area pretty safe. It wasn’t that you hated him: he was a welcome distraction sometimes. But he also tended to pop in during the shop’s busiest hours and end up attracting even more people, fans of varying ages. Not to mention he obviously knew he was good looking. He knew and had taken to flustering you for attention lately. “Just a few moody customers.”

“There’s always those.”

“Your coffee’s ready. Anything else?”

Hawks’ steps were deliberately slow as he headed towards the display case. His eyes twinkled with boyish mischief at the assortment of sweets he probably shouldn’t have.

Well, he was a grown man. He could have whatever he wanted. He shouldn’t, but he wasn’t going to stop him from buying things.

“That.” Hawks pointed at a particularly large cookie.

“Anything else?” You carefully slipped it into the corresponding paper sleeve before rolling off your glove to tap away at the register.

“Your number, maybe.”

Your blush reached the very tips of your ears before you could even process his request. “Hawks!”

He laughed as he slid his card down the reader. “You did say anything.”

Christ. You were sure your face was so hot you could feel it from several feet away. A pro-hero asking for your number. Who would even believe you?

He quirked a brow as he slowly took his things. His watch glistened under the usually soft lights. “Hey, you don’t have to.”

It was odd to see Hawks of all people looking the slightest bit deflated, but he didn’t exactly hurry outside. He calmly took his usual spot, russet feathers looking softer than you knew they felt as the lights scattered across the fuzz.

You found yourself scrambling to find the closest pen and scribble across a napkin. Hopefully he wasn’t joking. Stupid Hawks and his stupid personality.

You glanced around. No customers to tend to. You could afford to step out from behind the counter a minute or two. Smoothing your uniform, you walked to his table. “Hawks…?”

“Huh? Did I leave something over there?”

“Here.”

“What?– Oh!” He grinned and you just barely caught the almost excited ruffle of his wings. “Knew you’d come to your senses.” He winked playfully.

God damnit. There he went again.

~Admin Blue
